title: Dextrust_Defi
author: Dextrust_Defi
content: Preev is down! where do you check Bitcoin prices?

comments.author: Murat
comments.body: Try https://tokensfund.io/You can check both Bitcoin/ETH prices also ETH gas fees.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Check this existing discussion threads[1][2], there are suggestions for alternatives as well. I suggest to close/lock this thread and continue discussing on these threads below.[1] Preev.com - DNS hosting service has expired.[2] Preev.com appears to be down again!

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: A good alternative is the website created by the forum user examplens, preev.net.Click here to see the post made by examplens in another thread introducing the website.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: I am using google for bitcoin/eth price I know isn't the best solution but it is the fastest solution I have seen until now... preev was perfect service and really easy to use Others than suggested I am using as alternative https://preecs.coolstorage.org/Another price checker but different since here you have Graphs and other useful data (including some altcoins) is https://bitcoinwisdom.io/

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Dextrust_Defi on August 24, 2022, 08:25:54 AMPreev is down! where do you check Bitcoin prices? I didn't think this site was so popular that all of these topics were created due to a hiatus and I also didn't think that many would try to create more alternatives so quickly.You can use several alternatives, there is PNNV.com, Preev.net and Preev.com can return to work.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: Dextrust_Defi on August 24, 2022, 08:25:54 AMPreev is down! where do you check Bitcoin prices? I don't get why is preev so popular. The name is bad, the price is  not as accurate as coinmarket or coingecko... As mentioned by others, there are many alternatives I made one herehttps://bitcoindata.science/bitcoin-units-converter.html

comments.author: 100bitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: Dextrust_Defi on August 24, 2022, 08:25:54 AMPreev is down! where do you check Bitcoin prices? May be check my signature space.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Have you checked Preev.net which is already posted here on the forum and it is still under development I guess? You can find the thread here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5411037.0Don't forget google SERP also has its own just use the keyword "bitcoin price" and it should show the current price of Bitcoin. Coingecko and Coinmarketcap are also good alternatives.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: It looks like a number of members came up with an idea of creating a preev.com alternative after the previous incidents where it kept going offlineHere is another member who made another look alike (https://pnnv.com) Thread - https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5410871.0I sometimes use bitsusd.com

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on August 26, 2022, 06:32:56 PMI didn't think this site was so popular that all of these topics were created due to a hiatus and I also didn't think that many would try to create more alternatives so quickly.You can use several alternatives, there is PNNV.com, Preev.net and Preev.com can return to work.I am probably one of the biggest fan of preev.cimI used to visit it at least twice a day to check bitcoin price (although I don't own much of it) and every time I was about to send or receive a transaction.I liked it because it was fast, accurate and, most importantly, there were no ads.I've been using preev.com for the past couple of days but with all due respect to examples and I appreciate his efforts, but they are incomparable.Coinmarketcap is slow to load and not well optimized for mobile. It was way better before it got acquired by binance. I just visited pnnv and it doesn't look bad at all (very similar to preev.com).thanks for the suggestion hb.

comments.author: spiker777
comments.body: Quote from: agentF on August 30, 2022, 09:41:31 AMGuys I made an alternative website with a better domain: PNNV.comhere is announcement thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5410871.0it is same to same preev website with a different domain. but yeah. it is good as a backup. just checked the website and it is working smooth. hopefully you'll sustain it for the future. just don't get down like preev dead. i assume preev shut down their website because of low funding. they were not making any money from the website and obviously no one supported them with donations. so they were left with no options but to shut down the website.
